11. Directions given by traffic officers ___________ signs, signals or pavement markings.
12. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, you must:
column4: move into the left lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column6: move into the right lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column8: move into the right lane, or to the right side of a single lane.

column2: 13. You are stopped at a stop sign and you are going to go straight through the intersection. A car on the cross road has stopped at a stop sign on your right and is going to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
14. This regulatory sign tells drivers that:
column4: traffic in the left lane must turn left at the intersection ahead.
column6: all vehicles must turn left immediately.
column8: traffic in the right lane must go straight.

column2: 15. When they see a crossbuck sign, drivers:
column4: must always come to a complete stop.
column6: are legally required to yield the right of way to trains.
column8: must slow down and wait for the red lights to flash.

column2: 16. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Area reserved for people with disabilities

column2: 17. Which shape is a warning sign?
18. If a traffic officer signals you to drive through a red light:
column4: you must not obey the officer. Signs and signals take precedence over directions given by traffic officers.
column6: you must wait for the red light to turn green.

column2: 19. In case of skidding, drivers should NOT:
column4: pump the brakes gently if they are about to hit something.
column6: steer the car into the direction of the skid.
column8: take their foot off the gas pedal.
column10: tap the gas pedal with their foot.

column2: 20. Parking is not allowed:
column4: within 300 feet of a pedestrian safety area.
column6: in an intersection, unless permitted by signs.
column10: within 250 feet of a traffic light.

column2: 21. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: vehicles must leave the pavement immediately.
column6: the road surface ahead changes to a low-type surface or earth road.
column8: the dirt on the side of the road is soft.

column2: 22. If a bus has signaled and is pulling back onto the roadway, you must:
column6: honk to let them know you’re there.

column2: 23. You may park or stop along the shoulder of the freeway:
column4: as long as you turn on your emergency flashers.
column6: only if you have an emergency.
column8: if no part of your vehicle is on the road.
column10: if you need to check your smartphone for directions.

column2: 24. What can you do to prevent skids on snow and ice?
column4: Decrease pressure on the brake pedal if your wheels begin to lock.
column8: Allow the wheels to keep turning.

28. If you get on a wrong expressway exit, you must:
column4: drive in reverse to return to the expressway.
column6: use the the exit ramp to accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.
column8: get off at the next exit and look for signs that tell you how to return to the expressway.
column10: make a U-turn and return to the expressway.

32. If your brakes stop working, you should first:
column4: flash your lights at oncoming traffic.
column6: try to build up brake pressure by pumping the brake pedal several times.
column8: sound your horn to warn other drivers.

column2: 33. If you hear a thumping sound while driving, you should:
column8: hook your shoe under the gas pedal and see if you can free it.
column10: get off the road and check your tires.

column2: 34. If a person under 21 years old consumes alcohol, but is not driving a motor vehicle, the penalty for a first offense is _______ and a fine.

36. What should you do if a vehicle is approaching head-on in your lane?
column4: Turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.
column6: Come to a complete stop and use your horn to warn the vehicles behind you.
column8: Pull over to the left and use your emergency lights to stop the other driver.
column10: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other driver.

column2: 37. This road sign means:
column6: The minimum safe speed under any condition
column8: The maximum speed limit under ideal conditions
column10: You must travel through the intersection at the posted speed

column2: 38. If a driver follows you too closely, you should:
column4: increase your speed as you are probably driving too slowly.
column6: move to another lane if possible.

column2: 39. A 4-way stop sign means:
column6: There are four stop signs at the intersection.
column8: Traffic from all four directions must stop.
column10: The first vehicle to reach the intersection should move forward first.

column2: 40. To avoid being in a truck driver’s blind spot, you should:
column6: avoid driving on either side of the truck and don’t tailgate.
column8: never pass the truck and put your headlights on.
